thread.title: Sainz In Hospital After Final Practice Crash
thread.title_full: Sainz In Hospital After Final Practice Crash

title: Sainz In Hospital After Final Practice Crash
text:
Sainz In Hospital After Final Practice Crash 12:02,   Share by email Toro Rosso driver Carlos Sainz has been taken to hospital after suffering a big crash in final practice at the Russian GP. 
The Spanish driver was involved in a head-on collision with the barriers at Turn 13, with his car burying itself in the Tecpro barriers, which are designed to take the force of an accident. 
The FIA, the sport's governing body, has confirmed Sainz was conscious after his accident, with TV pictures showing the 21-year-old giving the thumbs-up as he was stretchered away from the scene of the crash. 
The Spaniard was placed in an ambulance and taken to the circuit's medical centre before being airlifted to hospital. 
Initial reports suggest he has escaped serious injury. 
"Carlos is conscious and he is with the doctors now and they will look at him," Toro Rosso team boss Franz Tost told Sky Sports F1. 
"Whether he will be able to continue the race weekend or not we don't know yet. When he comes back we will check and then we will see." 
Replays showed Sainz lost control of his STR10 approaching the corner, hitting the outside wall before running through the run-off area and into the barriers. 
"The car was lost under braking, but we need to find out the reason," Tost added. "We need the car for this, but at the minute it looks like nothing was broken." 
Due to the extensive damage done to the track barriers during Sainz's crash, the GP3 race which was due to follow Practice Three was cancelled. Promoted Stories
